column5: Hey guys, I don't post here much, but I read the forums a lot. Anyway I just wanted to share a picture of the first walleye of my life that I caught today.  We were out trolling on the grand river today the bite wasn't too hot it's always fun catching the cats out of there my friend Jay caught a 19 pounder and of course we forgot the net, the bugger was tough to get in the boat, and when we finally did he crapped all over the carpet haha. Count for the day is 3 cats for the boat, a big sheepshead and 2 walleyes caught by yours truly. Also want to add that the Conservation officers were out on the boat, they checked out licenses, checked out what we had in the livewells, and even gave us a couple tips. Good to see them out there checking everyone out!  Thanks for reading guys.
Oh, funny story goes with this as well. So as you know this was my first walleye, so I grabbed him by lip like a bass. Ouch! Hey dad! These guys have teeth!?
Nice walleye. Now go out and get yourself some more ! I suppose that sometime you have to learn things the hard way !!! ( fish with teeth )
congrats on your first Walleye, hope you didn't do too much damage to yourself lipping it!
Hey those Grand Eyes sure are beautifull.. Congrats! Is it wrong, that pic made me hungry?
they do bite back congrats on your first eye

Congrats on your first pickerel! My friend also caught her first pickerel this week and she was ecstatic!  Yup they have some big fangs. I remember catching my first bowfin and liping it. Man did it hurt!lol
Have you caught yer first pike yet?  JF
LOLOL...thats what i was thinking too john.   Anyhoo, sounds like a great days fishing....CONGRATS ON YOUR FIRST WALLEYES...not a bad size either from the pics!
That is undeniably the quote of the day!  Congratulations on #1
Very decent fish for your first walleye, congrat's!  (LOL @ johnnyb lipping a bowfin  )
The first walleye (pickerel) is always the hardest one...now that your almost a expert walleye fisherman catching them will get easier....at least that's what I keep telling myself...
